description: Ensure increments remain vertical slices (end-to-end flows across multiple epics/features, NOT horizontal layers). Each increment must deliver a complete working flow.

do.description: Design increments as vertical slices with end-to-end flows

guidance.description: Include partial features from multiple epics in each increment to create complete end-to-end working flow
example: Epic: Order Entry (2/5) - create order with name and item, validate basic info
Epic: Payment Processing (1/3) - process payment manually via admin tool
Epic: Order Storage (1/3) - save order to file
Epic: Order Display (1/4) - view order confirmation
Result: Complete flow from order entry through payment to confirmation

guidance.description: Each increment demonstrates working software from start to finish, not just one layer
example: Epic: Character Creation (2/8) - enter character name, assign basic abilities manually
Epic: Character Storage (1/3) - save character to file
Epic: Character Display (1/5) - view basic character sheet
Result: Can create, save, and view a character (complete vertical slice)

dont.description: Don't create horizontal layer increments that complete one epic at a time

guidance.description: Don't complete all features in one epic before moving to the next epic
example: Increment 1: Complete Epic A (all features done)
Increment 2: Complete Epic B (all features done)
WRONG: This creates horizontal layers that can't be tested end-to-end until final increment

guidance.description: Don't create increments that only touch one part of the system without complete flow
example: Epic: Order Entry (8/8) - all order entry features complete
NO payment, NO storage, NO confirmation
WRONG: Can't deliver working software, can't test end-to-end flow
